body.p: The American Orthopaedic Foot & Ankle Society (AOFAS) is pleased to introduce the first issue of Foot & Ankle International (FAI) by SAGE Publications. The convergence of FAI’s increase in high quality research submissions and SAGE’s publishing expertise and distribution channels offers new exciting opportunities for the journal. This issue of FAI debuts an updated cover design and a revised manuscript page format, signifying this major transition for the journal.

Beginning with this issue, AOFAS members and all subscribers will receive the print journal plus have free online access to FAI and its full archive, from the first issue in 1980 to the present. Additionally, manuscripts will be available digitally ahead of print via OnlineFirst. Electronic table of content alerts are offered and a variety of online features will improve functionality and access. In the summer of 2013, scored and recorded self-assessment examination credit hours for Maintenance of Certification (MOC) will launch providing further value to our readers. Watch for more information.

David Thordarson, MD, who has performed with distinction as Editor-in-Chief since 2007, will continue at the helm. To strengthen the editorial structure, appointments have been made to the editorial board and specific sections have been assigned to capable members. Elaine Leighton, who has managed transition of the editorial process to SAGE, assumes the role as FAI Managing Editor and remains as a member of the AOFAS staff in Rosemont, Illinois.
This is an exciting step forward in the development of Foot & Ankle International. Thank you for your support of FAI and its mission to improve foot and ankle care for patients.
